
BEDROOM.question: What does the 'volatile' keyword do in Java?
answers: It prevents the variable from being modified.
It prevents the variable from being accessed.
It ensures that the variable is visible to all threads.
It ensures that the variable is not visible to other threads.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'default' case in a switch statement in Java?
answers: To specify the value to match.
To provide a block of code to execute when no case matches.
To declare a default value for a variable.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'new' keyword in Java?
answers: To create a new instance of a class or array.
To allocate memory for a variable.
To assign a value to a variable.

answers: To compare two objects for equality.
To check if an object is an instance of a particular class.

To check if a class is a subclass of another class.

BEDROOM.question: What is the result of 10 == 10.0 in Java?
Which of the following statements is true about the 'finalize' method in Java?
answers: It is used to free the memory used by an object.
It is automatically called when an object is garbage collected.
It should be explicitly called by the programmer.
It is used to initialize an object.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'throws' keyword in Java?
answers: To declare that a method can throw exceptions.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'protected' access modifier in Java?
answers: To restrict access to the class.
To allow access from subclasses and classes in the same package.
To allow access from any class.
To make the variable protected from being modified.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'synchronized' keyword in Java?
answers: To ensure that a method can only be called by one thread at a time.
To synchronize variables in a multi-threaded environment.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'throws' clause in a method signature in Java?
answers: To declare checked exceptions that the method may throw.
To declare unchecked exceptions that the method may throw.
To catch exceptions thrown by the method.
To handle exceptions within the method.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'implements' keyword in Java?
What is the purpose of the 'super' keyword in Java?
answers: To access superclass methods and variables.
To access subclass methods and variables.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'private' access modifier in Java?
answers: To restrict access to the class.
To allow access from subclasses and classes in the same package.
To allow access from any class.
To restrict access to the class and its methods and variables.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'final' keyword in Java?
answers: To define a variable that cannot be modified.
To define a class that cannot be extended.
To define a method that cannot be overridden.

BEDROOM.question: What is the purpose of the 'static' keyword in Java?
answers: To define a variable that cannot be modified.
To define a method that cannot be overridden.
To define a method or variable that belongs to the class rather than instances of the class.
To define a method that is only accessible within the same package.
